page.title: 18British Rail Bracknell
page.content: The{British Rail}station in Bracknell is part of the{Southern Region.}This part of the Southern Region is electrified and runs between London{ {(Waterloo Station)}and{Reading}(which is one of the main stations on the Southern Region).The major stations on this line are:Waterloo,Clapham Junction,Staines,Richmond,Ascot,Early Bracknell,Wokingham and Reading. The station at Bracknell is quite new and has a large highrise office block over it.The station has two long platforms for the two lines on which the trains run to and from Waterloo and Reading.There is normally one train in each direction about every thirty minutes,although during rush hour,when many people living in Bracknell commute to London,the trains are more frequent.
